title: program_analytics_benchmarks query shows information not visible in public

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
**Summary:**
`program_analytics_benchmarks` is displaying information i don't see yet in public profile of a program.

**Description:**
I tried querying program_analytics_benchmarks for the program security and ██████ and it showing information i cannot find in public profile especially in ███████ 
### Steps To Reproduce
Please try the graphql for the the program security and ████████
```
{
  program_analytics_benchmarks(teams:"security" select:p50_time_to_bounty, from:response_targets, where:{severity:{is_null:true}},group:week_bounty_awarded_at, 
    start_date:"2019-10-01T00:00:00.000Z",end_date:"2020-10-01T00:00:00.000Z%00")
    {
      id
      x
      y
      
    }
}
```
Please see the attached file for the actual response



### Optional: Supporting Material/References (Screenshots)
███
███
 * 

I saved this graphql query and been trying to run this for a month now and i just noticed now that it's returning some information.

## Impact

Information disclosure

activities.message:
Hi @qw3ty, 

Thank you for your submission! 

> program_analytics_benchmarks is displaying information i don't see yet in public profile of a program.

Can you clarify what's the information you able to access and is it sensitive? if so what's the **security impact** of it.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @qw3ty,

Thank you for your submission!

program_analytics_benchmarks is displaying information i don't see yet in public profile of a program.

Can you clarify what's the information you able to access and is it sensitive? if so what's the security impact of it.

activities.message:
Hello Sir @chessmast3r,

I noticed that there is a value of Y in the response that i don't see couple of weeks ago.
I tried this query to the following programs: ==███, ██████, ████, ██████(no value), ████(no value), ████ and security==.

I noticed that changing the value of `p50_{parameter}` displays different value.

I decided to report this as soon as i think that it's something not visible in public profile those programs i mentioned above specially the ████ which has very limited information.

In Hackerone policy, it's mentioned that :

__If you do encounter any user data or program data, including but not limited to usernames, passwords, or vulnerability information, please report it to us immediately and stop testing right away.__

so i didn't go any further, i would like to consult first before i dig more.

I have some hackerone graphql queries in my note that i'm checking on daily basis to see if there some changes with the result.

Thank you Sir, please stay safe and healthy.

qw3ty
activities.markdown_message:

I tried this query to the following programs: ███, ██████, ████, ██████(no value), ████(no value), ████ and security.

I noticed that changing the value of p50_{parameter} displays different value.

I decided to report this as soon as i think that it's something not visible in public profile those programs i mentioned above specially the ████ which has very limited information.

so i didn't go any further, i would like to consult first before i dig more.

activities.message: While we are generally ok with this data being public (because it's aggregated) we did intend it for a small subset of programs. Looking at the ACL, it seems that you have found a bypass. We'll triage this and get a fix out, thanks!
activities.markdown_message: While we are generally ok with this data being public (because it's aggregated) we did intend it for a small subset of programs. Looking at the ACL, it seems that you have found a bypass. We'll triage this and get a fix out, thanks!

activities.message:
> Why low sir :( you've mentioned it's in ACL and it's bypass.

We determined it was low based this being an issue with access to a feature and not sensitive access to data. Thanks for understanding and verifying the fix!
